<s>[INST]A large language model did an evaluation of the Russian-English translation, which is given as below:
 The source text in Russian is idiomatic, saying "Бог дал два уха, а один язык" which literally translates to "God gave two ears and one tongue."

The reference English translation conveys the meaning behind the idiom, which is to listen more than you speak.

However, the machine-generated English translation only provides a word-for-word rendering of the original text, and fails to convey the intended meaning of the idiom.

Therefore, the machine-generated English text differs significantly from the reference English text, as it does not communicate the same message.

To improve the quality of the Russian-to-English translation, the system should be able to recognize idiomatic expressions and translate them in a culturally appropriate manner, as demonstrated in the reference English text.
Based on above analysis, score the machine translation quality on a continuous scale from 0 to 100, where score of zero means "no meaning preserved" and score of one hundred means "perfect meaning and grammar". Provide the score strictly in JSON format. [/INST]
